<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Larcenous Hand](/Feats.aspx?ID=3384) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 124</row>

**Archetype** [Spell Trickster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=126)

**Prerequisites**
[Agile Hand](/Feats.aspx?ID=3369); [Pickpocket](/Feats.aspx?ID=818)

</column>

---

When you cast [_mage hand_](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), you can remove its duration, modify its range to 20 feet, and modify its target to be an attended object within the spell's Bulk limit that wouldn't be time-consuming to remove. Add the following to the spell's standard effects: If the creature attending the object is willing to have you take the item, _mage hand_ carries the item to you. If the creature is unwilling, you must attempt to [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=68) the target object with a [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check. The usual restrictions on attempts to Steal an object apply, including the restrictions that you can't steal objects that would be extremely noticeable or time-consuming to remove (like worn shoes or armor or actively wielded objects) and you can't Steal from a creature in combat or otherwise on guard. On a successful Steal check, the _mage hand_ carries the item to you, and on a critical failure, you can't use this modification again for 1 hour. If you're a master in Thievery, you can attempt to Steal from a creature in combat or otherwise on guard, though if you do so, the spell's casting time increases by 1 action.
name: Larcenous Hand
